content.description: Probably the 'scrunchiest' of the sit starts on this face...harder than it appears at first glance. The start hold is a neat feature.
content.location: SDS just below and right of the large bulge by matching on a tufa-like sidepull. Move the LH up to a ledge like flat jug, then climb straight up using small pockets.

content.description: Short and sweet, this is a fun problem despite being only a few moves long. It features some cool holds with a nice texture.
content.location: The problems climbs the center of the face. SDS with a good incut for the RH and the LH on the small undercling slightly down and left. Climb straight up using rounded semi-pockets to a sloper, then deadpoint to the hueco on the right and top out.

content.description: This problem is a total one move wonder and slightly contrived,Â although the one move is fun and challenging.
content.location: Located just to the right of the center line, and left of the steeper overhang and tree. SDS using a flat white hold for the RH and a small dish for the LH. Set the feet and then make a long move with the LH to a "loaf shaped" sloper, then top out.

content.description: This boulder features a gently overhanging lowball face. The problems feature scrunchy sit starts and only a few moves to top out, which is a shame because the rock is really good and relatively skin friendly. It features some really cool holds as well. This one is definitely better suited for the folks on the shorter side...
